com.paypal.merchant.sdk
Interface CardReaderListener

public interface CardReaderListener

The CardReaderListener defines callbacks that will be invoked by the SDK to communicate
important events related to the Payment Readers.
The caller of CardReaderManager API may be required to provide a valid CardReaderListener
object to ensure that mandatory events are handled by the application. For example: when an
invalid credit card is present as the payment option, the payment reader will detect that the
card is invalid and invoke the onPaymentReaderError API. The error code and status message
will indicate the exact reason for failure which the app is then responsible for notifying the user
with. In this example, the app would notify that the user that the credit card was invalid and
that the operation should be tried again with a valid card

Nested Class Summary
static class CardReaderListener.CardErrors
          When dealing with cards we may encounter errors.
static interface CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvent
          When a Card Reader related event occurs your listeners will be passed an object of this type.
static class CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents
          These are the events you might be sent.
static class CardReaderListener.EMVConnectionStatus
           
static class CardReaderListener.ReaderConnectionTypes
          The ways in which we can currently connect to card readers.
static class CardReaderListener.ReaderTypes
          The current list of supported card reader types.

Method Detail

onPaymentReaderConnected

void onPaymentReaderConnected(CardReaderListener.ReaderTypes readerType,
                              CardReaderListener.ReaderConnectionTypes transport)
This method will be called back to indicate that a payment reader has been detected by the SDK. Follow this Reader Work Flow to understand more about when these APIs will be invoked and how to interpret the various error codes and extra information.

Parameters:
readerType; - indicates whether this is a magnetic stripe reading device or a more advanced device capable of reading cards with a Chip & PIN.
transport; - indicates how the reader is connected to this device (bluetooth, audio jack etc).

onPaymentReaderDisconnected

void onPaymentReaderDisconnected(CardReaderListener.ReaderTypes readerType)
This method will be called by the SDK to indicate that a reader previously connected to this device has now become disconnected. The reader could have been disconnected because the user intentionally did so or because of a weak connection (for ex: weak bluetooth connection). Tip: Applications should notify the user of this if this was not something that was expected so that the user can fix any potential connection issues

Parameters:
readerType - The type of reader that has disconnected.

onCardReadSuccess

void onCardReadSuccess(SecureCreditCard paymentCard)
Called when someone swipes (or inserts) their card via a hardware reader and we get a successful read.

Parameters:
paymentCard - A SecureCreditCard object. You can hold onto this object and supply it when attempting a payment or refund.

onCardReadFailed

void onCardReadFailed(PPError<CardReaderListener.CardErrors> reason)
Called when someone swipes (or inserts) their card via a hardware reader and we FAIL to get a successful read.

Parameters:
reason - An error from the CardErrors list with a possible detailed message.

onCardReaderEvent

void onCardReaderEvent(PPError<CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents> e)
This method will only be invoked if the underlying reader was capable of working with Chip and Pin cards. Applications can know this status by implementing the onPaymentReaderConnected callback or by invoking the API on the CardReaderManager to enquire the capabilities of the connected reader. When only a magnetic card reader is connected, this API will be never be invoked. In cases where the underlying reader is a capable chip & pin reader, there are several possible events for the application to handle.

Parameters:
e - A CardReaderEvent describing what has happened.

onSelectPaymentDecision

void onSelectPaymentDecision(List<ChipAndPinDecisionEvent> decisionEventList)
In case of EMV related flows, this method would be called by the SDK to inform the app that the customer's card inserted into the terminal has multiple payment options associated with it and the app is required to show the list back up to the user to select.
The selected ChipAndPinDecisionEvent is then needed to be passed back by the app to the SDK via the providePaymentDecision method within the CardReaderManager.

onInvalidListeningPort

void onInvalidListeningPort()
This function is called when Application doesn't specify listening port for device and calls waitForAuthorization() to take the card payments.
